newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Las Vegas casinos seek payment from HK gamblers.
newsitem.headline: Las Vegas casinos seek payment from HK gamblers.

text.p: Casinos in Las Vegas have taken legal action against five Hong Kong gamblers they say failed to repay more than US$400,000 in instant credit, a local newspaper reported on Sunday.

The Mirage Casino-Hotel, Desert Place Inc, Caesar's Palace and Las Vegas Hilton have filed writs seeking to recoup $414,460 from the men, who allegedly accepted credit lines of $25,000 to $100,000 from the casinos last year, the South China Morning Post said. "Most people we extend credit to pay it back in a reasonable period," it quoted a Las Vegas Hilton spokesman as saying.
"There are some people who do not pay it back, and we pursue it through private means, and then, if necessary, we will take legal action."
The Las Vegas Hilton spokesman denied the casino was overly eager to extend big credit lines to encourage gambling.
